label: Weapon Â· CE 139
name: Mannlicher-Carcano Rifle (C2766)
description: 6.5mm Italian carbine with serial number C2766, identified as the weapon used in the assassination. Recovered from the 6th floor of the TSBD.

events.title: Purchased
events.description: Ordered via mail from Klein's Sporting Goods

events.title: Recovered
events.description: Found on the 6th floor of the TSBD

label: Object Â· Exhibit 142
name: Brown Paper Sack (TSBD)
description: Large handmade paper bag found on the 6th floor of the TSBD. Alleged by the Warren Commission to have carried the rifle; alleged by Oswald to have contained 'curtain rods'.

label: Photographs Â· CE 133-A/B
name: Oswald Backyard Photographs
description: Photographs showing Lee Harvey Oswald in his backyard holding a rifle and socialist newspapers. Oswald claimed they were fakes.

name: Commission Exhibit 399
label: Ballistic Evidence Â· CE 399
description: Nearly pristine bullet found on a stretcher at Parkland Hospital. Alleged to have caused 7 wounds in Kennedy and Connally.

events.title: Discovered
events.description: Found on stretcher at Parkland Hospital by Darrell Tomlinson

label: Business Record Â· TBSC
name: Shop Bill No. 8760 / Invoice No. 36919
description: Texas Butchers Supply Company service record dated November 21, 1963. Billed November 23, 1963 to Arlington Food Stores for $12.00 (2-hour service call). Documents Yates' verified trip to Park-It Market in Irving, TX. Key evidence for establishing timeline of Yates' movements.

label: Vehicle Â· TBSC
name: TBSC Pickup Truck
description: Texas Butchers Supply Company pickup truck driven by Ralph Leon Yates on November 20/21, 1963. Vehicle used for refrigeration service calls. The hitchhiker rode in the cab with his package rather than placing it in the truck bed.

label: Package Â· Yates Testimony
name: Brown Paper Package ('Curtain Rods')
description: Package wrapped in brown wrapping paper, approximately 4 to 4.5 feet long. Carried by the hitchhiker picked up by Ralph Yates. The hitchhiker claimed it contained 'curtain rods' and insisted on carrying it in the cab rather than placing it in the truck bed. Potentially related to CE 142 (brown paper sack found on 6th floor of TSBD).

label: Photograph Â· Yates Testimony
name: Photograph of Man with Rifle
description: Photograph pulled from hitchhiker's pocket and shown to Yates. Depicted the hitchhiker holding a rifle. The hitchhiker asked Yates if he thought the President could be killed with a gun like the one shown. Yates initially claimed he did not look at it, but later provided detailed description. Potentially one of the Oswald backyard photographs.

label: Mugshot Â· Dallas Police
name: Dallas Police Photo 74018
description: Dallas Police Department photograph of Lee Harvey Oswald, labeled '74018, 11 23 63.' Used by FBI agents for Ralph Yates to positively identify the hitchhiker as Oswald on December 10, 1963.
